description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS), a leader in Cloud Computing, is seeking interns to join our AWS Professional Services Internship program. This is a unique opportunity for driven self-starters to play a key role in a fast-growing business and to deliver significant value to AWS customers of all sizes from public sector organizations, to nimble startups, to global brands. 
 
The skills and experiences you gain will be highly sought after throughout the industry and give you the opportunity for the career of a lifetime.
 
Upon successful completion of the Internship Program, selected interns will receive a full-time offer to join the Professional Services Consultant Program or the Tech U program depending on your specialization. These are accelerated workforce development programs focused on helping recent graduates and early career professionals build technical and professional skills to jump-start technical careers at AWS.Requirements:Currently in your penultimate or final year of a degree in:
Computer Science
Engineering
Mathematics
Technology
or Related science/technical field. 
Skills and Competencies:Interest and aptitude to learn about and deliver cloud-based solutions to customers.
Experience with one of the programming languages like Java, Python, Ruby, Node.js, C#, or C++ OR the interest and technical ability to learn a programming language.
Written and verbal communication skills and ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions to both large and small audiences.
Fluent proficiency in English.

description:
The National Heritage Council of South Africa is a statutory body that is responsible for the preservation of the country’s heritage. The internship opportunity listed below has become available. Applicants must be South African citizens and must not be older than 35 years of age.
 
Duration: 12 months contract
Reference No: HR/04/2023
 
Responsibilities:
Include but are not limited to:Assist with tracking of progress of important tasks, deadlines and priorities of all HR projects.
Prepare and compile documents, reports, presentations and correspondence.
Assist with Human Resources management functions related to recruitment and selection processes.
Assist with performance management administration, ensuring that parties have signed off all performance contracts and filed at HR
Coordinate employee induction
Assist with conducting exit interviews
Assist with electronic and hard copy filing
Schedule and coordinate calendar activities and bookings of meetings
Recording of minutes in meetings and distribute accordingly
Requirements:Degree or Diploma in: Human Resources Management
A postgraduate qualification will be an added advantage 
Skills and Competencies:Knowledge of relevant legislation BEEA, LRA, EEA etc.
Competent in MS Office software package
Good interpersonal skills and communication skills
Strong planning, organising and coordinating skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Exceptional attention to detail with and accurate and thorough approach to work
The ability to multi-task within a pressurised environment and to complete tasks timeously
Great work ethics and passionate about Human Resources
Ability to work in a fast paced environment
Positive and energetic self-starter
Eager to learn, Inquisitive mindset

description:
The Data Analytics Graduate / Internship Programme is to provide recent graduates with the opportunity to gain practical experience in the field of data analytics. The programme includes on-the-job training, mentoring, and structured learning opportunities to equip graduates with the skills necessary to become competent data analysts.
 
Responsibilities:Assist in performing operational functions in area of responsibility and updating information on systems where necessary.
Identify and resolve basic queries timeously, apply discretion in line with process guidelines provided and escalate unresolved problems.
Take accountability for delivery of contracted work outputs within agreed parameters, quality standards and targets.
Follow and adhere to individual learner activity manual for the division or business unit.
Develop and maintain productive working relationships with peers, SARS role players and third parties to achieve predefined objectives.
Communication of transactional outputs and queries in area of work according to policies and quality requirements.
Contribute to the development & improvement of area specific standards, procedures, and processes to ensure continued quality and service improvement.
Contribute to the successful implementation of change initiatives by providing support in area of work.
Deliver on contracted performance objectives and escalate unresolved delivery and quality issues to management and process owners.
Draw on own knowledge and experience to identify and develop solutions that leads to improved service delivery and quality.
Effectively plan and schedule own activities to continuously improve quality and service delivery in area of work.
Report on transactional and process activities within set guidelines to provide timely information for decision making.
Required Fields of Study / Qualifications:BEng (Industrial, Computer, Electronic, Chemical)
BSc (Actuarial, Applied Maths, Statistics)
BCom (Informatics, Accounting, Investment   Management, Statistics, Finance, Computer Science)
BSc (Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Computing)
National Diploma: Information Technology
No experience is required to be eligible for participation in the graduate trainee programme. 
Skills and Competencies:Fairness and Transparency                
Accountability
Conceptual Ability                  
Honesty and Integrity            
Trust               
Respect          
Honesty and Integrity                        
Attention to Detail                 
Building Sustainability

description:
Applications are hereby invited from unemployed graduates who wish to be placed in SANParks Internship Programme for a period of one (1) year with a monthly stipend of R6,030.00. SANParks is not obligated to employ the Intern upon programme completion.
 
 
The following Internship Opportunities are open for applications:
 
Department of Supply Chain Management Interns
Location: Golden Gate Highlands National Park
Diploma/B Degree in:Supply Chain Management
Procurement Management
Logistics
Finance / Accounting
Department of Finance Interns
Location: Groenkloof (Head Office)
Diploma/B Degree in:Postgrad - Forensic and Investigative Accounting
Department of Administration Interns
Location: Marakele National Park
Diploma/B Degree in:Financial Management
or equivalent
Applicant Requirements:Be an unemployed graduate between the ages of 18 and 35.
Must be a South African Citizen
Have completed a Bachelor's Degree/National Diploma (NQF 6/NQF 7) under the above-mentioned discipline/fields of study from a South African Public Higher Education Institution (HEI)
Must not have previously been employed nor participated in an Internship/placement programme

description:
We are looking for young, vibrant and passionate graduates to be employed on a 12 month Wholesale & Retail SETA funded learnership. These individuals will play an exciting role in our growth journey while growing their careers in the JD Group - one of South Africa’s largest wholesale and retail group.
 
The primary aim of this opportunity is to develop young, motivated and high performing graduates who will infuse their talent into the organization. The graduates will be given structured learning and workplace experience.
 
Key Responsibilities (but not limited to):Required to attend all on-boarding / induction programmes and meetings which provide information about different functions of the company
Execute duties as required, under the supervision of senior employees
Perform research and document trends within the various functions of the company such as for instance new technology that can be implemented, best practices, etc.
Visit different locations / stores in order to get hands on working experience
Make presentations on the basis of which he or she may be evaluate 
NB. Applicants should not have participated in any SETA programme before
 
Required Education:
We require graduates with the following qualifications:Marketing Management degree
Business Management / Business Administration degree
Human Resource Management/Industrial Psychology degree
B Com Financial Management
B Com Law / Economics
Digital Marketing relevant degree
BSc / B Com Software Engineering
IT Project Administration / Project Management degree
IT information systems / Business information Technology degree
Graduates from TVET Colleges and HET Institution within the retail and retail sector

description:
North West Provincial Treasury is inviting unemployed graduates to apply for Internship in the following fields of study below. Unemployed graduates with Disability are encouraged to apply.
 
Interns will receive a monthly stipend in accordance with DPSA Directive as well as with their highest qualification as at the date of their appointment.
 
Fields of study:
Internships are available in the following fields of study:
National Diploma or Degree in:Accounting
Economics
Management Accounting
Financial Accounting
Statistics
Econometrics

Financial Management

Aged between 18 and 35.
Applicants should have completed their studies.

description:
We are excited to announce that we have another year of 12-month internship opportunities available for in-house interns, funded by one of four banks.
 
This opportunity is open to candidates who've never held a full-time position before (this is a FirstJob opportunity) and preferably have not participated in a leanership or internship before.
 
Start date of the internship is 1 July 2023 and end date is 30 June 2024.Requirements:
This opportunity is open to candidates that:Have a minimum qualification of Grade 12 / Matric.
Must be a South African citizen.
Are between 18 and 34 years of age.
Preference will be given to individuals from previously disadvantaged backgrounds.
Live within 40 km from our offices/branches which is situated in Midrand, Halfway House.
Are not currently in fulltime studies and able to attend this internship full time.
Are willing to be subjected to a credit and criminal check or any industry specific checks required for your job role.

description:
Coronation is looking for graduates who are hungry to learn with a natural ability of providing exceptional service to clients and the keenness to explore a career in personal investments.
 
Our 23 months Internship Programme offers solid learning prospects as well as support for furthering your educational goals. On top of a competitive starting salary, you will also be supported by various experienced mentors and peers throughout your development journey with us.
 
Responsibilities:Handle incoming calls and/or emails
Handle unit trust, retirement, and life product queries
Liaise with clients re investment options and product information (Walk-in clients)
Deal with adviser queries via email
Deal with Link Investment Service Provider queries via email
Meet team service level targets and call/email handling quotas
Follow up on returned e-mails and post to maintain accurate client data records
Maintenance of relationships and commission arrangements with advisers
Maintenance of documentation in respect of Anti Money Laundering legislation and other static client data as required from time to time
Deal with Third Party Administrator to resolve client queries
Handle complaints, provide appropriate solutions and alternatives within the time limits and follow- up to ensure resolution
Support clients in the Coronation Online Services secure environment
Update information on our CRM system
Recognize service delivery failures and log errors with the correct parties
General query resolution
Navigate the workflow system 
Requirements:
A completed Bachelor’s Degree in:Accounting,
Finance,
Business science,
Economics,
Law,
Investment Management
or related fields
Skills and Competencies:Good communication skills: fluent in 2 South African languages
Client centric
Hungry to learn
Natural problem solver
Responsible and accountable
Passionate about investments
Accuracy and attention to detail
Flexible with an “I can” mentality
Able to work independently as well as part of a team

description:
The WILDTRUST is participating in the Youth Employment Services (YES) programme funded by NEDBANK and is aimed at reducing Youth unemployment levels. The YES programme provides a one-year work-based job training experience aimed at affording unemployed youth practical and meaningful work opportunities.
 
 
The WILDTRUST invites applications from unemployed youth, graduates and scholars who are between the ages of 18 and 27 years to apply for the following vacancies:
 
HR Assistants and Data Capturers
Location: Pietermaritzburg (KZN)
Requirements: Grade 12 / Matric certificate.
Advantageous: Any relevant post-matric qualifications and volunteer or other work experience will be advantageous.
Responsibilities: Computer literacy with good English and written skills Accurate and timeous data capturing Compile and update employee records Assist with monthly payroll reconciliations Maintaining an efficient filing system General assistance to the HR teamFinance and Admin Intern
Location: Pietermaritzburg (KZN)

Responsibilities: Finance and Admin background. Computer literacy with good English and written skills. Excellent organisational skills. Excellent analytical & reconciliation skills. Accurate and timeous data capturing. Ability to work under pressure & meet deadlines. Knowledge of Sage300(Accpac) advantageous. General assistance to the Finance and Admin team.Blue Port Crew - Waste Collectors
Location: Durban Harbour (KZN)

KwaDapha Community Resource Hub,

Report any suspicious behaviours and happenings. Secure all exits, doors and windows. Make guests aware of rules that must be adhered to. Remove trespassers or unwanted individuals from the property. Contact the relevant authorities if a crime is committed or an accident occurs. Report to supervisors on a regular basis. Ensure safety at the hub by helping monitor it overnightHousekeepers
Location: Mabibi Community Resource Hub,

Responsibilities: Clean entire hub facility (washing dishes, dusting, sweeping, cleaning ceiling vents, restroom cleaning, emptying rubbish bins, dusting shelves, cleaning windows, mopping floors, polishing) 2. Ensure all rooms are cared for and inspected according to standards 3. Protect equipment and make sure there are no inadequacies 4. Notify superiors on any damages, deficits and disturbances 5. Deal with reasonable complaints/requests with professionalism and patience 6. Check stocking levels of all consumables and replace when appropriate 7. Adhere strictly to rules regarding health and safety and be aware of any company-related practices 8. Deal with reasonable complaints/requests with professionalism and patienceGardeners

Maintain all gardening equipment and machinery, like mowers, trimmers and leaf blowers 5. Monitor and maintain the health of plants 6. Deal with pest problems that could damage plants 7. Keep gardens and green spaces clear of litter 8. Planting and caring for vegetables and trees in the greenhouse.Environmental educators

Engage with schools to book visiting slots 3. Host a minimum of 3 marine awareness event activations per year at each hub, specifically aimed at younger (<10 years) children, including film screening and story reading activations 4. Host all hub visitors and ensure health and safety of visiting learners/students, teachers, parents, and co-workers at the hubs 7. Requirements: Grade 12/Matric.

description:
This is a 12-month contract for unemployed graduatesto join our FirstJob work experience programme. The focus of this programme is to improve employability of successful candidates.
 
Throughout the programme, the incumbent willhave an opportunity to build workplace confidence and competence by contributing to business objectives and deliverables. The incumbent will be required to successfully complete prescribed development programme.
 
Requirements:A recognized Diploma
A recognized Bachelor’s degree is advantageous
No formal (corporate) work experience 
NB. Candidate's Qualification will be matched against the requirements of Business Units across FirstRandAdditional Requirements: Must be between the ages of 18 – 34
Obtained a relevant post matric qualification
Must have been unemployed for at least the last 6 months
Must have no or limited work experience – i.e. a total of less than twelve months’ work experience and/or of a part-time, casual nature. This must be the youth’s FIRST job experience
The youth must also not have previously participated in the FirstJob programme at any of the FirstRand franchises, and not worked for FirstRand before
No Referral plan is assigned to this job 
Skills and Competencies:Skills required include:
Analytical Thinking
Excellence and quality orientation
Building relationships
Teamwork
Problem solving
Learning agility
Resilience and Stress Management
Drive and Results orientation

description:
The Purpose of the Internship programme is to offer UJ graduates (degree/diploma) who have no previous working experience the opportunity to obtain practical workplace experience and exposure.
 
The Programme will offer opportunities for unemployed graduates to gain beneficial university-based experience in a range of areas that can improve their readiness for employment and open career pathways that may not have been available without the work experience. It is also an opportunity to potentially identify future talent for potential employment.Requirements:Graduates must be between the ages of 18 and 35.
Not studying full time (preferably attending after hours classes).

description:
The BBD Grad Programme lets you bridge the gap between what you’ve learnt at university and what you need to flourish in the IT industry. As a BBD grad you’ll gain real project experience from the very first week and build your technical knowledge through exposure to a wide range of technologies and methodologies.
 
You’ll learn first-hand how to break and fix things, all the while working hard and having fun alongside your senior mentors and your graduate class. Our graduates tell us they learn more in their first 8 weeks at BBD than they did throughout their university studies so the pace is as fast as you can handle.
 
Locations: Cape Town and Johannesburg,
 
Education Requirements:Must have a BSc / BEng / BCom / BIT majoring in:
Computer Science,
Computer and Software Engineering,
Information Technology
or Informatics. 
Alternatively if you have a portfolio of technology work you have completed that you can demonstrate to us you may also be considered. 
If you have a vision for how software can solve daily problems, make the world around us a better place and have actually tried to do something about it then you’re definitely who we are looking for.
Further requirements:Be immersed in, and have engaged with, technology / coding over and above your formal education
Be a newly qualified graduate at a recognised university or hold a certification from a recognised learning programme
Have a high academic average
Be passionate about building software and creatively solving issues and bugs

description:
Duration: 12 months contract
Stipend: R5391.00 per month
Reference No: Ref No: FPI/4/23
 
Responsibilities:Assist with the SCM office administration including meeting bookings for the committees.
Assisting in the documents allocation/ circulation during tender evaluations including booking meeting venue in a timely manner.
Assist to prepare monthly and quarterly SCM reports.
Execute the complete Competitive Open Tender, RFI and RFQ processes including accurate capturing of scores.
Ensure that procurement processes within different departments are adhered to with regards to compliance and Internal controls.
Ensure that all the tender submission prequalification checks and verification are performed on time and loaded on the NCR website
Responsible for obtaining and analysing quotations from suppliers, do the scoring according to the PPPFA and follow-up on orders to ensure on-time delivery.
Maintaining a contract register by updating it for new contracts, amendments, expired contracts and with reminders. 
Requirements:3 year Degree / Diploma in:
Supply Chain Management,
Logistics,
Finance
Procurement
or equivalent qualification.
Applicants must not have worked or participated in an internship before.
No experience required.
Skills and Competencies:Computer literate, proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel.
Attention to details, ability to work under pressure, self-driven and motivated.
High ethical standards.
Flexible and motivated team member and customer focused.
Communication Skills (Written and Verbal).
Demonstrate honesty and commitment
Knowledge of procurement processes and standards.
PFMA, National Treasury Regulations.
Report writing.
RFQ and Tendering process.

description:
The South African franchise invites unemployed graduates to apply for the 2024 Jumpstart Internship Programme. 
 
The intern will be part of the CIB business, gaining exposure of a world-class organisation in the South African franchise. The successful applicant will be employed in one of our lines of business in Banking; Markets; Operations; Finance or Technology.  
 
This opportunity will allow the intern to network with and be business-mentored by our very proficient professionals and leaders both in the local and global business, while taking a very hands-on approach in the day-to-day role.
 
The Internship will run for 12 months from January 2024 to December 2024, with a possibility for renewal up to December 2025, based on mutual agreement between the company and the graduate. 
 
Requirements:Final year Bachelor’s degree with sound academic results (all faculties are welcome).
Matric certificate – please add to your CV
University transcript - please add to your CV
Skills and Competencies:Self starter – be able to work without constant supervision
Good communication and listening skills
Attention to detail
Strong analytical skills
Strong time management skills and able to adhere to strict deadlines
Can-do attitude 
NB. Please note that shortlisted candidates for the 2024 Jumpstart Internship Programme will be required to successfully complete the 3-week Winter Internship Programme in 2023 during the University winter vacation period (3 July 2023- 21 July 2023).

Gabsten Technologies has opportunities for current IT students that require work-integrated learning experience to complete their IT qualifications.

description:
Graduates will work and learn at the SARB Head Office from January to December 2024. They will be assigned to a department and exposed to various tasks and projects.
 
During the Programme, graduates will attend various learning interventions at the SARB Academy. Interventions are mainly specific to central banking and are aimed at producing well-rounded central bankers.
 
As part of the holistic programme, graduates will also gain personal and professional skills such as assertive communication, public speaking and presentations, creating powerful PowerPoint presentations, impactful reporting, teamwork and personal excellence and etiquette.
 
At the end of the year, successful graduates will be permanently appointed into a department of the SARB. 
 
Requirements:
Applications are open to candidates who have a postgraduate qualification in one of the following fields:Economics,
Econometrics,
Research,
Policy Analysis,
Public Finance,
Accounting,
Auditing,
Statistics,
Financial Management,
Information Technology,
Law,
Portfolio Or Investment Management,
Mathematics,
Quantitative Analysis,
Business Analysis,
Project Management,
Risk Management (Operational and Financial Risk),
Treasury,
International Relations.
Applicant Requirements:Have completed a postgraduate degree;
Are a South African citizen;
Have a strong desire to work in financial services and/or policymaking;
Have a proven track record of academic excellence;
Hve excellent communication and interpersonal skills;
Are a curious and keen learner.

description:
We are seeking motivated, ambitious, matriculated individuals with a strong foundation in Mathematics & Science. A higher qualification would be advantageous however not mandatory.
 
The business will cater for experiential training focused on the industry in which we operate. This will be over a twelve-month period. This field offers a sustainable career with outstanding growth opportunities.
 
Responsibilities:Be at place of work timeously 
Learning, which will require a high level of personal commitment 
Demonstrate the ability to apply what has been learned
Prioritise training needs and requirements.
Comply with business standards and processes.
Comply with Safety and Health Business Requirements
Contribute to the company Vision and Mission 
Requirements:
Grade 12 with the following subjects completed, at least with a pass mark of 60%  Mathematics Core (Mathematics Literacy will not be considered)
Physical Science 
English (First or Second Language) 
Skills and Competencies:Self-directed learning approach
Solutions driven 
Entrepreneurial
Ability to work collaboratively in a Team or independently
High level of pro-activity
Resilience
Detail Orientation
High level of Emotional Intelligence
Innovative
Inherent Service Ethic
Accountability

description:
This role will be responsible for managing all aspects of contract renewals for the medium business segment. You will establish yourself as a trusted advisor and accountable for the identification of growth opportunities in collaboration with business partners and their customer base
 
Responsibilities:Ensure Business partner/ customer queries are responded to within the specified turnaround time via digital responses
Deliver revenue performance and operational outcomes in line with budgetary expectations and performance KPI’s
Build strong alliances with Business Partners to facilitate successful 90-day planning around linked renewals
Establish strong collaboration with sales teams, providing regular insight on assigned customers and assisting to identify opportunities for incremental revenue
Align, Influence, and manage across lines of business to drive business value and ensure prompt resolution of escalated issues
Develop and maintain strong professional relationships with customers and Business Partners to ensure customer satisfaction and retention
Provide accurate and timely forecasting for monthly, quarterly, and annual performance, including risk and opportunity analysis
Other duties as required from time to time (Customer nurture campaigns etc)
Play an integral role in supporting the company’s cloud migration strategy
Requirements:A Bachelors Degree or National Diploma in Accounting or related preferred (NQF 7)

description:
The purpose of this 12 months graduate programme is to provide support to the Human Resources department to ensure successful implementation of business initiatives or programmes that meet SABC's objectives.
 
This is an exciting opportunity for those who have completed their HRM Diploma or HRM Degree in industrial Psychologist and looking to enhance their skills and experience in the work environment.
 
The Human Resources Team is responsible for providing HR services, advising, and supporting the relevant region/ unit in order to establish and implement HR programmes that foster the organization and people development for them.
 
Responsibilities:Facilitate the termination of employment
Coordinate and action relocation/ transfers of employees i.e. allowance payment.
Facilitate the compliance and completing declaration of business interest(s) on SAP.
Prepare and submit inputs into human resource monthly reports
Keep abreast of human resources practices and labour law updates in order to provide a one-stop professional human resource service
Uses HR technology and systems (SAP) to extract relevant HR data for line management to make better decisions on workforce issues/matters
Compile and presents meaningful HR reports through interpretation, comparisons and trend analyses
Oversees the process of ensuring data integrity of HR system
Conduct and analyse exit interviews with suggestions on improvement to line management
Requirements:
Diploma/Degree in:Human Resources Management
Industrial Psychology
or related discipline

description:
The purpose of the Young Professional in Training Programme is to develop a pipeline for key roles within Transnet Port Terminals (TPT) through a structured 24-month training programme.
 
The programme seeks to place Young Professional in specific areas within TPT according to their academic background, career aspirations and business requirements.
 
Responsibilities:Work with the audit teams to conduct an audit assignment as defined in a scoping letter by carrying out the required audit tests and steps, documenting systems, testing controls and preparing working papers to support findings.
Undertake follow-up audits to assess the implementation of agreed actions.
Undertake research and fieldwork for ad hoc and unplanned assignments.
Participate in relevant working groups as a representative of Internal Audit and contribute to the development of robust systems of control within the organisation.
Review various submissions to the senior for accuracy, relevancy and completeness before presenting documents for approval by the GM.
Ensure accuracy of information and reports produced by reviewing own work before submission to manager.
Participate in working groups as a representative of Internal Audit and contribute to the development of robust systems of control within the organisation.
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in:Auditing
Accounting
Commerce 
Skills and Competencies:Able to meet deadlines and work under pressure.
Attention to detail and personality that thrives on creativity.
Decision-making and proactive thinking.
General MS Office skills.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Communication skills, both verbal and written.

description:
We are looking for an HR Intern to perform various administrative tasks and support our HR department’s daily activities.
 
Responsibilities:Update our internal databases with new employee information, including contact details and employment forms
Prepare HR-related reports as needed
Participate in organizing company events and careers days
Assist with recruitment and onboarding process for new hires.
Cross-collaborate with the team to enhance the operations of the department.
Assist with human resources-related administration.
Plan and coordinate HR events or functions.
Maintaining an effective filing system and updating the internal HR database.
Assist with the annual BBB-EE audit process.
Assist with the implementation of Organisational Development and Employee Wellness initiatives.
Assisting the HR Manager and Transformation Executive with ad hoc projects.
Receiving HR-related queries and refer employees to the right member of the team.
Requirements:
A minimum of N6 /Diploma/Degree in:
Human Resources
Industrial psychology
or related field 
Skills and Competencies:Proficiency in Ms. Office: Excel, Word, and PowerPoint essential.
Excellent organizational skills with an ability to prioritize important projects.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with attention to detail.
Work well in the team and be able to drive individual assignments/projects.
The ability to multi-task will be key for this role.
Understanding of labor laws BCEA, LRA, EEA, SDA, BBB-EE

description:
CIPC (a member of the dtic) is committed to youth skills development by providing graduates with opportunities to gain work experience to complement their studies. Applicants are invited for an Internship Programme that would run for a period of 12 months. Interns will be placed in our Sunnyside Office (Pretoria).
 
Successful applicants will be expected to sign a Graduate Internship Programme Agreement.
 
Position Title: Group Risk, Compliance and Governance Internship
Remuneration: R12 000,00 pm
 
Required Fields of study:Degree / Diploma in: Auditing, Risk Management or Law. (Advantageous: Specialisation in Forensic studies or Fraud prevention will be an added advantage)
Degree / Diploma in: Commerce. (Advantageous: Specialisation in Risk management or Auditing will be an added advantage).
Degree / Diploma in: Law or Commerce. (Advantageous: Specialisation in Compliance Management or Governance will be an added advantage).
Applicant Requirements:Unemployed South African graduates from higher education institutions who have completed their degrees/diplomas.
Unemployed graduates who have not been exposed to work experience related to the area of study that they have completed.
Applicants must be between the ages of 18 to 35 years old.

position: Readiness Experience Drive (RED) Vacation Work Programme 2023
description:
Our RED Programme is the ideal vacation work opportunity to gain first-hand experience of what it means to be a CA(SA) and to learn about the world of work, as well as yourself. Students from 3rd and 4th year (CTA) can apply to join the office closest to them and experience what it is like to work at BDO.
 
The RED Vacation work Programme is held in person, and our commitment to you and this process is unhindered. We would expect the same of you.
 
BDO’s RED Vacation Work Programme offers:Structured, output-based environment
Grow your knowledge and experience as a student and potential Trainee.
Open the door to join a dynamic and fast-growing team servicing BDO clients which are listed. 
Meet, Interact, and develop relationships with, BDO SA managers and partners Stretch yourself personally and professionally.
Requirements:
Any 3rd or 4th year (CTA) full-time university student who is studying:BCom in Accounting
BCompt
Bachelor of Accountancy
Bachelor of  Business Science leading to a qualification as a CA (SA) at any southern African university accredited by SAICA
BCom/BCompt Honours
PGDAS/CTA

Your potential internship in Unilever is crafted to offer inexperienced graduates opportunities to work and develop in a structured way, with the goal of developing future-fit skills and experience in Unilever that prepare you for the world of work and future employment opportunities.

Supply Chain Planning, Logistics, Procurement InternsA 3 Year University degree in any discipline with a preference for BComm Supply Chain, BBS

description:
As a global consulting partnership in more than 40 countries, our people make us who we are. We’re individuals who take as much joy from those we work with as the work itself. Driven to be the difference between a big idea and making it happen, we help our clients break through.
 
What You Can ExpectIndividual and inclusive to our core. As a business analyst intern, you will receive full and ready access to our firm’s best talent to help you learn, develop and make your mark.
Personal and practical. You will work alongside colleagues who will help you grow as you help our clients solve their most important issues – that’s just our style.
We’re big enough to have it covered, small enough to really care. This holds true for both you and our clients. 
You will be able to make an impact and develop your potential from day one within a professional environment and culture that actively fosters the following:Personal development. At Kearney, we encourage you to be yourself, and we give you the freedom to contribute creatively while you also learn, develop and make your mark. 
Entrepreneurial approach. The Kearney internship program is an outstanding introduction to the discipline of management consulting
Supportive environment. Training is a crucial component of your introduction to the firm. As a business analyst intern, you will learn essential concepts and methodologies that are crucial to management consulting. 
 We are looking for talented problem-solvers who are ready to integrate as full members of the client team. Interns are expected to contribute ideas, opinions, and new information.
 
The following Qualifications are preferred:A proven record of academic excellence with a bachelor's degree
Minimum of a 65% overall average.
No more than 2 subjects failed through your degree.  
Skills and Competencies:Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Strong critical thinking and analytical capabilities
An innovative and collaborative approach to problem-solving
Natural self-direction, with the ability to operate in ambiguity and learn quickly
Eagerness to collaborate, and help others grow professionally
Proficiency in Microsoft Office
Proficiency in English language

description:
Our Winter Internship programme is a 3-week paid vacation internship programme commencing on the 26th June till 14th July 2023 for undergraduate university students. The three week programme offers in-office work experience in our Corporate Finance team in South Africa.
 
Your time here will look something like this.
The program starts with a firm wide orientation where you’ll learn about our culture, as well as the benefits and responsibilities of being a member of Citi. You will receive real time responsibilities to give you a sense of what you would be doing on a day to day basis, as a full-time Citi employee.  With fellow interns, you will work alongside leaders within Citi.
 
Responsibilities:Hands on work experience as a member of either the Corporate or the Investment Banking business unit
Get a solid understanding of the broad range of financial services and products Citi provides
Learn to build financial models and develop corporate finance solutions for our clients - we strive to create the best outcomes for our clients with financial ingenuity that simple, creative and responsible solutions
Conduct research and analyze industry trends to support our bespoke advice and superior value proposition
Participate in client development - Citi aims to be the best banking partner for our clients by delivering differentiated client experiences and maintaining a reputation of excellence
Requirements:
We want to hear from you if...We look for highly motivated candidates with a strong work ethic, a positive and proactive mindset, and a firm desire to learn and succeed
A keen interest in financial markets and current affairs is critical
We value diverse thinking and encourage students from all degree disciplines to consider our opportunities.
Advantageous: Studies in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Engineering and Information Technology subjects are beneficial but not essential
A strong academic record at both Matric and university level is important

description:
Workplace Experience Programme (WEP) is our annual Internship programme where we host 3rd/final year students from across South Africa to discover and explore a career in retail.
 
This is an opportunity to learn about our culture, the way we operate and the retail industry while following a tailored programme designed to give you on-the-job exposure to your field of study.
 
When Does the Programme Start?Monday 26th June - Friday 14th July 2023 The following Internship Opportunities are open for applications:
 
Planner: Workplace Experience Programme
Must be studying any one of the following qualifications (Diploma/Degree) Commerce
Business Science
Accounting
Mathematics
Statistics
Economics
Finance
Strategic Management
Supply Chain
Retail
Logistics
Buying: Workplace Experience Programme
Must be studying any one of the following qualifications (Diploma/Degree) Fashion Design
Clothing Management
Consumer Science
Fashion Production
Fashion Buying
Fashion Management & Communications
Interior Design
Textiles
Design, Graphic Design , Marketing: Workplace Experience Programme
Must be studying any one of the following qualifications (Diploma/Degree) Fashion Design
Graphic Design 
General Marketing
Graphic Design
Video Technology or related

position: June Vacation Internship - Data Science (For Current Students) 2023
description:
ResponsibilitiesBe an out-of-the-box thinker who is passionate about brainstorming innovative ways to use our unique data to answer business problems
Extract and understand data to form an opinion on how to best help our clients and derive relevant insights
Working closely with teams across all regions in CEMEA to develop scalable and innovative big data and machine learning solutions
Applying industry leading data science techniques to generate impactful insights for clients and to address real business problems
Developing visualizations to conduct diagnostics and to connect ideas into well-grounded insights for scalable reporting using tools such as Tableau and PowerBI
Performing data analysis on large and complex dataset using tools such as Python/SQL/Spark to provide actionable recommendations 
Requirements:Degree in a quantitative field such as:
Computer Science,
Mathematics,
Statistics
Econometrics
Students pursuing a Bachelor’s (Honors) or Masters Degree with a graduation date by end of 2023 or 2024
Be available to pursue the internship June to September 2023 (Full-time)
Excellent communication, story-telling and presentation skills
Skills and Competencies:Extracting and aggregating data from large data sets using SQL/Hive or Spark
Analyzing large data sets using programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, SAS and/or Spark and using development environments such as Jupyter Notebooks
Generating and visualizing data-based insights in software such as Tableau
Communicating data-driven insights and conveying actionable recommendations
Managing and organizing work in Office software such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint and/or Teams
Building predictive and descriptive statistical models using machine learning tool kit, Jupyter notebooks, Python, and/or SAS
Data mining and statistical modeling (e.g., regression modeling, clustering techniques, decision trees, etc.)
Superior analytical and financial analysis skills
Strong collaboration skills with a diverse peer group required

position: EMEA Banking Winter Vacation Internship Programme 2023
description:
Whether you’ve got prior financial industry experience or not, this 3-week internship provides an opportunity to work for one of the world’s largest financial services organisations.  If your internship is successful, you could be considered for one of Citi’s full-time graduate or analyst programmes. 
 
These uniquely designed full-time programmes place university graduates in specific functional teams within the bank. Our full-time programmes start with extensive classroom training and also the opportunity to complete globally recognised qualifications.
 
Your time here will look something like this:                                                                                                                Hands on work experience as a member of either the Corporate or the Investment Banking business unit
Get a solid understanding of the broad range of financial services and products Citi provides
Learn to build financial models and develop corporate finance solutions for our clients - we strive to create the best outcomes for our clients with financial ingenuity that simple, creative and responsible solutions
Conduct research and analyze industry trends to support our bespoke advice and superior value proposition
Participate in client development - Citi aims to be the best banking partner for our clients by delivering differentiated client experiences and maintaining a reputation of excellence and integrity     
We want to hear from you if...We look for highly motivated candidates with a strong work ethic, a positive and proactive mindset, and a firm desire to learn and succeed
A keen interest in financial markets and current affairs is critical
We value diverse thinking and encourage students from all degree disciplines to consider our opportunities.
A strong academic record at both Matric and university level is important
Studies in: Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Engineering and Information Technology subjects are beneficial but not essential 
Skills and Competencies:Desire to develop a deep understanding of the financial markets and banking industry
Analytical and quantitative skills
Strong communication, planning and organizational skills
Knowledge of the global or domestic business landscape
A strong desire to learn and success in team environments
Commitment to personal growth and career development

description:
Purpose of the role: Our Client Service Centre is integral to our service offering for investors and our network of independent financial advisers. Our Investment Service Consultants are university graduates equipped with products, business and industry knowledge to support our investors and independent financial advisers effectively.
 
Should you be selected to experience your internship in Retail Client Services, you will work alongside smart individuals on specialized projects designed to further enhance our service delivery to clients.
 
Responsibilities:
The successful interns will be placed in suitable roles,  either Investment Service Consultant or Retail Operations for a 2 week internship to solve different challenges in each, with an opportunity to get exposure to the business, be mentored by others and present their results to senior management at Allan Gray.
 
Requirements:This internship is only open to final year students currently completing an under or post graduate Commerce or Business Science degree with majors in: Finance, Economics, Investments, Engineering, Mathematics and Statistics.
Consistently strong academic performance
Must be eligible to work in South Africa
Skills and Competencies:Strong client focus and interest in investments
An enquiring mind and problem-solving abilities
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work in a team of highly skilled individuals while delivering on your own personalised goals
Highly adaptable and resilient

description:
Our Winter Analyst programme is designed to offer you a broad and exciting experience of work within Investment Banking. During your internship, you will be gaining exposure to a variety of industry, country or product coverage teams.
 
Your training and development are our top priorities with structured support offered on the job, networking opportunities, educational speaker events and mentorship throughout.
 
Responsibilities:
As an Intern, your key tasks and responsibilities may include but are not limited to:Work on projects alongside bankers in specific industry, product and country coverage groups providing you with a unique learning opportunity
Help the team deliver solutions to clients leveraging full spectrum of the Bank's capabilities
Actively contribute to the preparation of client presentations and underlying financial analysis
Build relationships, knowledge and experience that will open doors to a wide range of future career opportunities
Through our unique pooling system, you will have the opportunity to work across multiple areas, giving you a broad understanding of the investment banking profession and offer you the chance to explore your best fit for a full-time placement
Requirements:Candidates are required to be in their penultimate year of study pursuing a degree from an accredited college or university
Strong A-level grades and on-track for a minimum 2:1 degree classification (or equivalent)
Fluency in English is essential for all our roles 
NB. For some roles within Emerging Markets (including sub-Sahara Africa, Russia and China), a knowledge of those regions is required so that support in the marketing of products, advising and coordinating the marketing effort to existing and potential investor base in the emerging markets region can be provided.
 
Skills and Competencies:You'll need to demonstrate drive, innovation and a genuine interest in the financial markets
Teamwork, leadership and problem-solving skills,
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment,
Displaying analytical and problem-solving skills
Influencing decisions and outcomes through effective communication and interpersonal skills
Demonstrating integrity and ethics by earning other's trust and respect through consistent honesty and professionalism in all interactions
